snippet.textDisplay: I'm not a fan of any of the games starring Yoshi (I know, heretic), but I've got to admit, this is one great piece of music.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not a fan of any of the games starring Yoshi (I know, heretic), but I've got to admit, this is one great piece of music.

snippet.textDisplay: I loved Yoshi's Island, but pretty much any other game starring Yoshi as the hero was mediocre at best to me.

snippet.textDisplay: I dunno, it depends on how well it's done. Super Mario World had the same basic melody for all of the levels, including the ghost houses and castles, but it's done so subtly that it's hard to notice.

snippet.textDisplay: rented this from blockbuster ages ago. I was SURPRISED how short it was. I mean, I knew it had replay value in the collectables and such, but I could not imagine someone justifying a full purchase price for it.

snippet.textDisplay: I played this when I was a lot younger and going through an unhappy period in my life (I'm much better off now :) ), and had to stop at some points because I was afraid to see the crying Yoshis getting carried off if I "died."

snippet.textDisplay:
While a surprisingly memorable game, it still was a dissapointment for me, as a 'sequel' to Yoshi's Island. It was barely challenging, some bosses in particular being piss easy, the platforming was meh since you had a huge jumping range, and nothing really stood out.

Didn't keep me from finishing it about a dozen times to find all the levels though.
snippet.textOriginal:
While a surprisingly memorable game, it still was a dissapointment for me, as a 'sequel' to Yoshi's Island. It was barely challenging, some bosses in particular being piss easy, the platforming was meh since you had a huge jumping range, and nothing really stood out.

Didn't keep me from finishing it about a dozen times to find all the levels though.

snippet.textDisplay:
God, this game was awful on so many levels- not the least of which was because it ruined Yoshi forever. From badass dino to Barney wannabe in one game flat.

Also, Super Mario World had the same theme for each of its stages, but it did a better job of hiding it.
snippet.textOriginal:
God, this game was awful on so many levels- not the least of which was because it ruined Yoshi forever. From badass dino to Barney wannabe in one game flat.

Also, Super Mario World had the same theme for each of its stages, but it did a better job of hiding it.

snippet.textDisplay: The game's main theme, simple yet memorable. I do have to say that I'm not a big fan of games that use the same theme over and over again but with different instruments for the different levels. Yoshi's Island DS had the same problem.
snippet.textOriginal: The game's main theme, simple yet memorable. I do have to say that I'm not a big fan of games that use the same theme over and over again but with different instruments for the different levels. Yoshi's Island DS had the same problem.
